description:
Hi Experts,

I need your help on this. VlanManager on single-host OpenStack can NOT work.
The test bed I use is as below.

OpenStack release:     grizzly
OS:                                    Cent OS 6.4
Type of network:          VlanManager (nova-network)
Host condition:             single-host (NOT multi-host)

I am trying to build VlanManager environment with OpenStack grizzly on Cent OS 6.4, but it doesn't work. VM creation failed.
I am using all-in-one architecture (single-host). FlatDHCPManager successfully worked on the host.

I am assuming that I came across a bug/defect that VlanManager can't work with single-host environment. 
I'd like OpenStack team to examine and determine if there is such a bug related to VlanManger on single-host environment.

Thank you very much in advance,
Bird Kafka
title: VlanManager on single-host OpenStack can NOT work

comments.content:
Hi Experts,

Customer needs to determine if we hit a bug as soon as possible.
Could you please, assign an engineer to look into this issue?

Thank you in advance,
Bird Kafka
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~starlight-s

comments.content: Hi. This isn't the right mechanism for a support request. Please email your question to <email address hidden>, where you're much more likely to get assistance.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal

comments.content:
Hi Michael,

We need to determine if this issue is a bug or not for customer.
If this is a duplicated bug, could you please, let me know the ID of the original bug?

Thank you in advance,
BirdKafka
